locations.name: Muscat
locations.description: Oman's capital city, known for its blend of traditional architecture (like the Sultan Qaboos Grand Mosque and Mutrah Souk) and modern elegance along the coast.

locations.name: Wahiba Sands
locations.description: A vast desert region (also known as Sharqiya Sands) famous for its rolling dunes, Bedouin culture, and opportunities for overnight desert camping experiences.

locations.name: Nizwa
locations.description: A historic city in the foothills of the Hajar Mountains, renowned for its impressive fort, traditional souk specializing in silverwork, and role as a former capital.

locations.name: Maldives
locations.description: An island nation in the Indian Ocean, synonymous with luxury resorts, pristine beaches, clear turquoise waters, and abundant marine life, offering relaxation and water sports.
